Job description

Case Manager / Counsellor- Reconnect


  • Are you passionate about young people at risk of being homeless, and their families?
  • This is a rewarding permanent part-time opportunity based at Cabramatta
  • Make a genuine and lasting difference in the lives of young and vulnerable people and their families \xa0

About the role:


You will be supporting at risk young people and their families to address issues of homelessness and family breakdown. Must be able to demonstrate an understanding of the needs/issues of young people at risk of being homeless, disengaged from education and community.


Key responsibilities (not limited to):


  • Collates and maintains clear up to date organised and accurate records and case notes
  • Keeps informed of theoretical and practice issues that ensure best practice is developed and maintained
  • Establish and maintain links with other agencies, to facilitate the provision of a holistic and quality service and to provide information on issues including referral processes, client needs, local issues, community feedback and approaches or gaps in service delivery.
  • Ensure effective service delivery, this includes utilising a variety of family focused tools such as counselling, mediation and coaching to assist in regards to\xa0engaging a young person in family, education and community.
  • Contributes to establishing and maintaining healthy family relationships by the use of dispute and conflict resolution as identified.
  • Develop, present and evaluate group work.

Skills, knowledge and experience needed:


  • Tertiary qualifications in relevant tertiary studies, e.g. social work , psychology
  • Demonstrated understanding of the needs/issues of people from refugee/migrant, varying socio-economic and diverse CALD backgrounds
  • Counselling skills with appropriate experience, qualifications and membership of the relevant professional body.
  • Experience in working with young people, their families and people experiencing disadvantage.
  • A current NSW driver's licence and comprehensively insured motor vehicle

This role requires a valid Working With Children Check. Anglicare is committed to being a child-safe, child-friendly organisation.


Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.


Anglicare - Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched and communities strengthened


Applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible as applications may be reviewed prior to the closing date; and as such the closing date is subject to change without notice.

Studio Coordinator (6 month contract, 3 days a week)

Company Name UniSuper Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds, and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 35 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $70 billion on behalf of 400,000+ current and former higher education and research employees.

The opportunity

You will assist UniSuper to deliver quality communications that enhance the brand, achieve optimal usability and reflect our core values by effectively managing the workflow and prioritisation of requests for the design team. You’ll scope each design brief to identify how many hours will be required to complete the task and identify outstanding items that are required to complete the job.

It will be important to meet with internal stakeholders to clarify and refine the requirements of briefs and negotiate timelines for a seamless design process. You will also provide design and layout expertise for print and online environments for UniSuper’s communication initiatives, as well as effectively briefing designers on requirements.

You will coordinate the relationship with external typesetters during PDS rolls, on behalf of the designers, and ensure the smooth running of the print management function. Checking that all design output meets the UniSuper brand guidelines, outsourcing work as required, and working with UniSuper suppliers to ensure that the brand guidelines are accurately represented will keep you busy! In addition, you will provide overflow graphic design support as needed.

About You

Ideally you’ll bring your own mix of skills and experience to the team, but some of that will include:
  • Capacity to use an electronic management, filing and retrieval of information/documents
  • Experience in design and development of communications materials for print and electronic environments
  • Excellent information technology skills across a variety of design applications, MS Office, Adobe Macromedia Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and Flex, InDesign and web content management systems

What We Offer

An opportunity to join a leading and growing super fund at an exciting time. Work with others who care about creating quality communications in a collaborative and fun environment. We also offer gym discounts and have onsite massages to ensure your health and well-being.

If this resonates and you think it's the right next move for you, please get in touch.

This role is being recruited by our internal Talent Team and should we require recruitment agency assistance, we will reach out to our preferred partners.

Entry level

Company Name Department of Education & Training, Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Job description

This is an exciting opportunity to work on the RTO Performance Indicators project in the Higher Education and Skills Group within the Department. Victoria is a national leader in monitoring student and employer outcomes from VET training through the RTO Performance Indicators work and the role of Senior Performance Analyst will be key in expanding the analysis and reporting on student and employer outcomes. The Senior Performance Analyst also contributes to improving the evidence available, support policy development and monitor Skills First implementation. Applicants with strong stakeholder management skills, strong conceptual and analytical capabilities and an excellent ability to effectively communicate analytical findings to senior management are encouraged to apply.

The role of the Senior Performance Analyst is to undertake system performance analysis and reporting for the Higher Education and Skills Group, including analysis of survey results from the annual Student Satisfaction Survey and Employer Satisfaction and Skills Survey. This includes undertaking in-depth analysis of the Department's corporate data warehouse, using industry standard tools such as SQL, R, Analysis services, Excel and SAS. This involves examining and implementing innovative approaches to the presentation of analysis that will support senior management and key stakeholders to understand system performance. This information will also be used as input into other reporting processes such as budget, annual reporting and parliamentary updates.

This role includes consulting with key stakeholders, or their delegates, on performance analysis reporting to improve the evidence available and how it can be best used by stakeholders.

One ongoing position and up to two fixed-term positions (12 months) are available.

For more details regarding this position please see attached position description.

Department of Education and Training is committed to diversity. The Department places considerable effort and resources into responding to the needs of staff with a disability. People from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply for this position. With our first aged care residence constructed in 1997, Arcare is the largest private residential aged care provider in Australia. We currently have over 35 residences throughout Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland.

911671878:
[

Senior Historical Archaeology Officer

Company Name Office of Environment and Heritage (NSW) Company Location City of Parramatta, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title: Senior Historical Archaeology Officer
Job Grade / Classification: Environment Officer Class 9
Employment Type: Ongoing, full-time
Location: Parramatta

If you enjoy working on heritage sites why not use your specialised historical archaeology skills to this interesting role in a fun team at the Heritage Division!

Agency Overview

The Department of Planning & Environment is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.

The Department’s vision – “Planning for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment” – provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment.

The NSW Office of Environment and Heritage aims to enrich life in NSW by helping the community to conserve and enjoy our environment and heritage.

About The Role

This role covers a variety of tasks relating to the provision of advice, reports, representation in forums, the assessment of applications, including research and design methodologies and applications for historic archaeology approvals and permits under the Heritage Act 1977.

The role requires you to liaise with a wide variety of stakeholders both internal and external where you will need to utilise your knowledge and experience to ensure the conservation of significant historic archaeology across NSW. You would also liaise with the Maritime Archaeologists in the Specialist Services Team.

You would work alongside the Senior Historical Archaeologist, reporting to the Senior Team Leader, Specialist Services.

Primary Purpose Of The Role

Contribute to the implementation of the Government’s heritage policy objectives and statutory requirements for heritage conservation within NSW; provide professional, archaeological focused advice on diverse heritage and conservation issues to the Minister, Government, local government, State agencies and the community. The role contributes to the delivery of the Heritage Division’s vision of Celebrating, Sharing and Connecting our stories, our history and places in NSW.

Essential Requirements
  • Tertiary qualifications in archaeology or equivalent or relevant practical experience, and accumulated knowledge and interest in heritage conservation; in particular, historical archaeology.
  • Experience in, and understanding of, the archaeological assessment process and experience in developing and implementing management strategies for archaeological sites.
To be successful in the role, ideally you will have:
  • Demonstrated knowledge in the assessment and management of archaeological heritage as it relates to local, state and commonwealth legislation.
  • Demonstrated experience and experience in archaeological fieldwork; and working as an archaeologist where you have been involved with commercial projects which had heritage requirements.
  • Current driver’s licence.
Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:
  • Role description
  • Application Guide
  • Applying for a role in the NSW Public Sector
Our Commitment To Diversity And Flexibility

At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW.

We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Good To Know

A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period

To Apply

Complete all the questions in the online application. Two of the questions will require you to provide specific examples from your experience (4000-character limit per question). These questions are shown below. Do not address these in your cover letter

Q1. Describe a situation when you dealt with company ethics or values which were different from your own. How did you approach the situation? What was the outcome?

Q2. Describe a time where achieving results was heavily reliant on you tapping into your expertise, or the expertise of others and how you about leveraged your expertise and what impact did it have?

The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Applications Close: 11.59 pm 24 October 2018

Should you require further information about the role please contact; Siobhan Lavelle 0455 093 962 if you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Sharon Sorensen (02) 8275 1853.

If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.”

Associate

  • Environmental Services
  • Government Administration

Job description

Applications are now open to candidates who are anticipating initial registration as a Registered Nurse and or Midwife in 2019 and are either: Ineligible for Post Medical Council of Victoria (PMCV) Computer Match OR Unmatched from PMCV Computer Match, to join the Monash Health Graduate Program.

The Monash Health Graduate Program Offers Nurses
  • A twelve month structured program to consolidate your skills
  • Two (2) six-month rotations with an extensive range of acute and specialty areas on offer
  • Fixed term, 12 month graduate contract
  • Part-time hours (0.84 EFT; 64 hours per fortnight)
  • Five (5) weeks annual leave pro rata over twelve (12) months


Nurses And Or Midwives
  • A twelve month structured program to consolidate your skills;
  • Four (4) three-month rotations within a 12-month program
    • Two (2) birth suite rotations
    • Two (2) post/antenatal rotations or if double degree one (1) of these will be a nursing rotation in a wide range of acute clinical areas
  • Fixed term, 12 month graduate contract
  • Part-time hours (0.84 EFT; 64 hours per fortnight)
  • Five (5) weeks annual leave pro rata over twelve (12) months

This program has a clinical commencement date of February 4th, 2019 with a comprehensive orientation program conducted in January 2019, unless an August commencement date is preferenced.

About The Role

The Monash Health Graduate Program takes pride in providing our Graduates with excellent opportunities to consolidate their skills, expand their experience as a beginning practitioner and grow their career. Key elements of the program include:
  • The opportunity to rotate across the Monash Health network which includes Monash Medical Centre, Monash Children’s Hospital, Jessie MacPherson Private Hospital, Dandenong Hospital, the Kingston Centre, Moorabbin Hospital, Casey Hospital and Cranbourne Integrated Care Centre
  • Paid supernumerary period for each rotation
  • Support from our dedicated clinical education team
  • Paid graduate specific study days, tutorials and debriefs
  • Access to the employee assistance program
  • Access to the Monash Health Simulation Centre
  • Salary Packaging
  • Onsite parking, gym and fitness centre

Why Monash Health?
  • Exposure to caring for patients across the life-span
  • Opportunity to rotate into a specialty area
  • Build your confidence within an innovative and supportive team
  • As Victoria’s largest healthcare provider we foster a diverse learning environment which can only further develop your skills and enhance your knowledge
  • At Monash Health we are committed to delivering high quality patient centred care to fulfil our vision of “Exceptional Care, Outstanding Outcomes”

Application Process

When applying for the Monash Health Graduate Program you must:
  • Create an account/login on the Monash Health e-Recruit website
  • Prepare your application as per the ‘2019 Graduate Program Application Guidelines’ (see the ‘Position Documents’ section below)
  • Submit your application to the ‘Monash Health Graduate Program – Computer Match Ineligible Nursing’ job advertisement on the Monash Health e-Recruit website.

For your application you will need to complete and upload the following documents:

Monash Health Graduate Program Application Template

Please find a copy of the Monash Health Graduate Program Application Template in the ‘Position Documents’ section of this job advertisement. Please save, complete and upload a copy of this template under the ‘Resume’ field when you submit your application documents in the Monash Health e-Recruit system.

Academic transcript

As part of your application you will need to submit a certified copy of your most recent official academic transcript. Please upload your transcript under the ‘Education Certificate’ field when you submit your application documents in the Monash Health e-Recruit system.

Clinical Appraisals

Upload certified copies of your two (2) most recent clinical summative appraisal documents/tools under the ‘Other Documents’ field when you submit your application documentation. Monash Health accepts online appraisals that have been digitally certified by education providers.

  • Monash Health Fit2Work Form

    You can find a copy of the Fit2Work form in the ‘Position Documents’ section of the job advertisement. The ‘Monash Health Fit2work’ form and certified copies of the required identification documents must be scanned and uploaded into the specified ‘Fit2work Form’ field in the Monash Health e-Recruit system when submitting your application.

    For further information to assist you with preparing your application please refer to the ‘2019 Graduate Program Post PMCV Application Guidelines’ in the ‘Position Documents’ section below.

    If you are looking for endless opportunities in a supportive environment, then the Monash Health Graduate Program is for you.

    You can also access further information on our website: http://www.monashhealth.org/index.php/page/graduate_program

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Laing O’Rourke

Laing O’Rourke is a $6 billion international operation with 50 years of involvement in Australian construction and infrastructure including more than a decade under the Laing O’Rourke banner. The business is currently delivering some of Australia’s most exciting projects across the transport, building construction, defence, airports, mining, civil and social infrastructure sectors. Laing O’Rourke is committed to becoming the recognised leader for innovation and excellence in the construction industry and has twice been named as one of Australia’s Top 10 most innovative businesses by BRW Magazine.

About The Role

We are currently seeking expressions of interest from Procurement Leaders to join Laing O’Rourke in Adelaide (and also Brisbane and Sydney). As a Procurement Leader, you will drive the implementation of procurement on a project throughout the delivery phase.

Key Responsibilities

You will be responsible for resourcing and organising the procurement function on one of our Major Projects to effectively work with the wider project team to deliver successful procurement outcomes.

You will be responsible for setting procurement protocols, including the controls and reporting mechanisms to ensure an effective process is implemented.

You will develop and implement sourcing strategies. You will identify key stakeholders and manage relationships, and work with the HSE team to implement leading safety initiatives, in-line with our Next Gear Safety model.

You will have

As the suitable candidate you will be a strategic thinker, who is able to develop and implement successful procurement strategies to successfully engage with the supply chain at all stages of the project lifecycle.

Ideally you will have 5+ years’ experience in a similar role, with excellent planning, analytical and problem-solving skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills.

You will bring strong commercial acumen, and skills/knowledge of procurement practices and processes, negotiations and contract management, backed by relevant Tertiary Qualifications.

You will draw on your high-level interpersonal and relationship-building skills to build relationships with stakeholders and the supply chain, and will excel in working both autonomously and as part of a team.

We are seeking experience in building or civil projects with top-tier contractors. Experience in delivering defence projects would be beneficial.

Culture

At Laing O’Rourke we work hard to create an environment that brings out the very best in our people.

We believe in building careers – not just creating jobs and in putting our people at the heart of everything we do.

We want to equip all Laing O’Rourke people with the skills they need to be part of a dynamic Engineering Enterprise and ensure they feel supported in their roles and rewarded for their efforts.

We have our own specialised learning and development programme, providing access to industry-leading learning tools to help every employee acquire the core competencies and skills needed to compete in this fast-changing environment.

Laing O'Rourke is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.

Applications from recruitment agencies will not be considered.

The Hospital

The Royal Children's Hospital (RCH) Melbourne is one of the world's great children's hospitals. We are the major specialist paediatric hospital in Victoria and our care extends to children from Tasmania, southern New South Wales and other states around Australia and overseas. With a passionate, highly skilled and committed staff campus wide of over 4500, we provide a full range of clinical services, tertiary care and health promotion and prevention programs for children and young people. The Royal Children’s Hospital is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. Click here for further information on our Commitment to Child Safety: http://www.rch.org.au/quality/child-safety/

The Role

The primary responsibility of this position is provision of specialist high quality nutritional care to paediatric patients requiring dietary modification or nutritional support and their families; clinical workload will include specialist units of care. The role includes the provision of clinical leadership and mentoring within the dietetic team, care and participation in quality activities and projects, student supervision and teaching, and co-ordination of department courses. Current project management work includes a funded project grant: improving dietetic access and support for ketogenic diet patients with epilepsy.

  • Eligibility for full Membership of the Dietitians Association of Australia and eligibility for the Accredited Practising Dietitian Program.

Registrar - Ringwood Magistrates' Court
  • Full time, Ongoing

Registrars of the Magistrates' Court perform a wide range of administrative tasks throughout the Court's registries in Victoria. These may include in-court (bench clerk) duties, client-contact (telephone and counter) enquiries, and back-of-office administrative responsibilities. This role may be performed in a range of jurisdictional contexts, including Civil, Criminal, Family Violence, VoCAT, Diversion and Children's Court.

Registrars are also required to exercise powers conferred under the Magistrates' Court Act 1989, other Acts and Rules. These powers involve the preparation and processing of administrative and statutory documentation and the exercise of discretionary quasi-judicial and statutory powers using professional judgement in applying legislative requirements, established rules and precedents, and the Court's Practice Directions.

CSV is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture. We strongly encourage people of all abilities to apply, particularly people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, and those who may experience diversity or disability related barriers in securing employment.

Magistrates' Court of Victoria's vision is that all employees access and enjoy the same rights, responsibilities, resources and opportunities regardless of their gender, identity or cultural beliefs. Project Coordinator

Job description

Project Coordinators (QLD & NSW)


Solgen Energy Group has led the way in the design and delivery of Australia’s most iconic solar projects over the past 10 years. With a national presence and outstanding reputation, our organisation is rapidly expanding in an industry with unprecedented growth.


Comprised of a well-rounded and dedicated team of people – engineers, project managers, salespeople, client relations experts and specialists – our function is to design, deliver and accelerate the power of clean energy for everyone.


Solgen Energy Group sets the standard in renewable energy.

\xa0

The Role


The Project Coordinator is responsible for managing the coordination of projects within the Solgen commercial solar installation team. The role involves managing subcontractor inductions and performance, as well as supporting the project managers and engineers by managing the below tasks per project, and providing an interface between the Solgen QLD office and NSW office.

\xa0

Duties & Responsibilities


  • Administration and coordination support for Project Coordination Team Lead, Project Managers and Operations team
  • Initial project planning submissions, including council applications, building permits, and grid connection applications
  • Managing project dates, purchase orders, costs and other project management systems relating to the project;
  • Assist the Project Coordinator Team Lead in managing the subcontractor network;
  • Assist in identifying gaps and potential areas for development in Solgen’s project delivery capability and support the implementation of improvement initiatives as appropriate;
  • Develop and manage project and WHS documentation and records;
  • Working in conjunction with the procurement team and project managers to ensure material orders are processed in advance of project commencement;
  • Compile project installation and handover documentation;
  • Communicate with customers and subcontractors to manage the delivery of the above;
  • Consistently be an effective role model for Solgen Energy Group’s values.


\xa0

Skills & Experience


Essential criteria:

  • Demonstrated experience in working self-sufficiently and showing strong initiative;
  • Excellent problem solving capabilities;
  • Well developed, detail-orientated organisation and planning skills;
  • Strong interpersonal and written / verbal English communication skills;
  • Ability to work within a dynamic team;
  • Excellent computer skills (MS Suite, typical enterprise and project management systems)


\xa0

Desirable (non-essential) criteria:

  • Experience in subcontractor management and construction related businesses
  • Experience working with technical professionals coordinating projects
  • Knowledge of PV and/or electrical engineering terminology and an interest in the industry
  • Experience working for a major industrial or commercial rooftop solar installation provider;
  • Knowledge of the software systems Solgen uses to manage its business processes (NetSuite, Procore, CAD)


If you think this opportunity sounds perfect for you, please apply now with your resume and a cover letter outlining how you meet these requirements.

Transcriber

Company Name Vision Australia Company Location City of Parramatta, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 2 Year contract role
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Excellent Salary packaging benefits
    • Vision Australia is a leading national provider of blindness and low vision services in Australia. We work in partnership with Australians who are blind or have low vision to help them achieve the possibilities they choose in life.

    We support more than 27,500 people of all ages and life stages, and circumstances. We do this through 28 Vision Australia centres in Victoria, New South Wales, the Australian Capital Territory, Queensland, South Australia and Western Australia; 30 clinics; and through outreach programs in the Northern Territory and Tasmania.

    An exciting opportunity awaits an experienced Accessible Format Producer to join our team in Parramatta, New South Wales.

    Responsibilities

    As an Accessible Format Producer at Vision Australia you will:
    • Transcribe and re-format electronic and written material into a range of accessible formats including braille, large print, tactile diagrams, xml/html, ePub, accessible PDF, DAISY and electronic format using appropriate software and design techniques.
    • Ensure all work is produced and completed within agreed timeframes
    • Ensure that all aspects of production achieve a high standard for clients, and meet all standards/key performance indicators set by Vision Australia
    • Interpret and transcribe visual/graphical material into tactual graphics and/or detailed descriptions using appropriate software and/or other means


    Requirements

    To be successful in this role you will have:
    • Tertiary level or equivalent qualification in a relevant field would be highly regarded.
    • Qualifications in Maths/Science, computing and/or programming languages, such C++ and Java.
    • Experience working with diverse commercial publishing files formats such as ePub 3.
    • Experience with XML/HTML based coding is desirable
    • Experience with graphics and vector based software
    • Experience with OCR applications

    Working as part of Vision Australia you will enjoy a values based organisation with benefits including:
    • Friendly values based working environments
    • Generous salary packaging options
    • Exciting career paths
    • Exceptional professional development opportunities
    • Flexible working arrangements

    We’re always on the lookout for energetic, motivated people who share our values to be Person Centred, Accountable, Collaborative, Commercially Focused and Agile.

    Do you want to become a part of a team that supports a future where our clients have the opportunity like never before to live the life they choose? Please select the 'Apply' button below to be taken to our online application process.

    Applications should consist of a full resume and a cover letter. Candidates should address the essential job competencies as outlined the position description and should also consider and be able to demonstrate Vision Australia’s organisational values which are central to the organisation’s culture. Applications should be uploaded as a word file. Please note pdf documents are not accepted for accessibility reasons.

912584971:
[

Digital Specialist

Company Name IKEA Australia Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.


We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Digital Specialist to join our Web, Ecommerce & Digital team based at our Service Office in Tempe. The role reports into the Digital Optimisation Manager and is responsible for the end to end digital user experience and content management to convert more consumers into customers.


About you

As a savvy Digital Specialist with minimum of 2 years digital experience you understand the importance of putting the customer at the centre of the communication. Your outgoing personality and your passion to work with business stakeholders sets you apart. You like working in a changing environment and bring analytical decision making into everything you do. With an interest in home furnishing and people’s everyday life at home, our ideal candidate will have an understanding of user experience, content management and best practices in E-commerce retail. You will also have proven experience with Adobe Creative Suite, Content Management Systems, Google Analytics & a basic knowledge of HTML & CSS.

\xa0

About the job

Ecommerce is a new sales channel for IKEA in Australia with enormous potential. The online business is part of our global multichannel strategy and supports our ambition to become the world’s leading multichannel retailer. You will have the opportunity to support all digital channel visitors by offering the best browsing experience throughout the IKEA range. Contributing actively to attract and convert more consumers to customers and encourage existing customers to shop more frequently by using digital skills and home furnishing competence.

\xa0

About the assignment

In this assignment you will be responsible for but not limited to;

  • Contributing to site performance with a focus on driving conversion
  • Driving UX improvements across ikea.com.au with a focus on commerciality and user experience
  • Planning and keeping site product catalogues optimised and relevant to commercial priorities
  • Performance follow up of digital campaigns
  • Optimising the layout on the product listing pages, show width and depth of the IKEA range to support the seasonality and commercial priorities while simplifying the buying process
  • Following up the performance of the digital merchandising by measuring the engagement on the pages
  • Contributing to conversion optimisation by sharing recommendations with the sales leaders, for example for add-on sales and cross-selling.\xa0\xa0\xa0
\xa0\xa0\xa0

The IKEA Group is a world leader in the home furnishing business. We are a values-driven company with a passion for life at home. Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. The IKEA Group operates in 43 countries and our retail operations include 321 IKEA stores in 28 countries.
